description: Discover the finest non-vegetarian dishes from Srinagar, featuring mouthwatering flavors and traditional recipes that will tantalize your taste buds!
title: Best Non-Veg Srinagar

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Srinagar at Lal Chowk, Alka Salka Restaurant is a culinary gem that beckons food enthusiasts, especially those with a penchant for Wazwan cuisine. This charming eatery boasts an inviting ambiance adorned with stunning decor and exudes warmth through its exceptional hospitality. Diners can indulge in signature dishes like the rich Rogan Josh, aromatic Modur Pulao, and succulent Gushtaba.
places.name: Alka Salka

reviews.text: The service was extremely slow ‚Äî waited nearly an hour before any food arrived. Staff seemed disorganized, and it was frustrating trying to get their attention. Definitely not ideal if you‚Äôre on a schedule.

Had a meal here, and honestly, it was a letdown. The food was okay‚Äînothing exceptional‚Äîbut the service was terrible. The staff seemed uninterested, and the overall ambience was dull and unimpressive
The worst part? After finishing our meal, there was no water available at the handwash station. How does a restaurant run out of water? That‚Äôs basic hygiene!
And to top it all off, we ordered boneless butter chicken, but instead of actual boneless pieces, they just removed the bones from regular chicken and served it. That‚Äôs not what we paid for!
Absolutely disappointed and won‚Äôt be visiting again. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone.

The food served here is good but the portions are little lesser. Rates are economical. The ambiance is not so happening as expected. The staff is cordial and warm. They know their job very well. You can enjoy a good meal if you can overlook the other things.

I'm not sure why this restaurant is rated only 3.6 as of today. This place had better service, staff and food than other famous restaurants in the locality.

Their Mutton Burra is simply the best dish I've ever had. For mains we had Chicken Pudhina which was another 5/5 dish.
Nice family option in the midst of cluster cafes and restaurants. Oriental food was good. Good spacious tables.

places.address: 3RCC+QQW, The Bund Road, Munshi Bagh, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190001

places.name: De-linz Restaurant - Best Restaurant in Srinagar/ Top Restaurant in Srinagar/ Best Veg and Non-veg Restaurant in Srinagar

reviews.text: The restaurant serves good food. The ambiance is not too lively but okay. One of the best parts of the visit was the lime soda that was refreshing and perfectly balanced. A fun touch is while you wait for your food, you can enjoy a game like Jenga or even read a book both are available there.

Amazing food quality and service. One of the best restaurants where you would feel satisfied.
Also the compliment Kahwa was special.
Very agrasiv staff n food quality  was not good ‚Ä¶jaise free m khana de rhy thy‚Ä¶ dont go there paise barbad hoty h‚Ä¶ rice was  very old about two days

I DO NOT RECOMMEND this place. They served my these small chicken pieces swimming in oil in the name of bUtTeR cHicKeN. And when I called their manager he started cursing and yelling on the phone. Disgusting atmosphere man.

I fell management can‚Äôt handle the expansion.
Food quality of Wazaan Thali is worst.
Can‚Äôt able to manage a family.
Table‚Äôs not available for more than 4 persons neither they manage to join tables and accommodate them.
Older staff is arrogant with rude behaviour‚Ä¶
Their is much more options in Srinagar to go for.

I was going their since 2007 at their old restaurant but now i feel to switch for new one my second turn was their today but i was ashamed with their quality and behaviour now don‚Äôt recommend to anyone‚Ä¶

places.address: 1st Floor, Clay Model House, Barzulla Bridge, opp. J7k Bank Baghat, Asrar Colony, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190005

places.name: Pappe Di Hatti

reviews.text: Worst ever chicken i had ever eaten..2 tanduris and 1 full kadhai chicken..portion of meat is so large that even cooking it for 1 hour it tastes like raw chicken..eat somewhere elese but dont eat this..waste of money 100percent..find some other chicken place..cost is also very high 1350 rs for 2 tanduris and kadhai chicken..its value after being prepared should not be more than 100 rs for very poor preparation

Want to eat good Punjabi food in Srinagar - this is the place
Cook is very amiable
May have to forgo the seating option
Can sit in your car as well

This place is more of a dhaba than some fancy restaurant,so keep your expectations calm.
Dine-in space is limited & at times there's no space for even waiting.
There's no sense of privacy if you seek being in a space where passers can't look in.

Food is ok & only non-veg options are available.
if anyone who seeks jhatka-chicken as a priority can go to this place for a meal & sate their taste-buds & food choice.

Apart from that the food is not that exceptional,plus it's not that elegant if you're into the looks of the dish more than the taste.

Thanks & enjoy the desi vibe.

Good non vegetarian food.
Can be spicy for most of persons.
All chicken dishes available...loved Goshtaba and kababs
No sitting arrangement.
Bad thing....its in Gurudwara premises.. which does not go as per MARYADA....
The food is great and freshly cooked taste also good location is something if you are going to visit with family i‚Äôll not suggest, you can pack, this is mainly kind of mens location.

places.address: 3R77+P2Q, Lal Mandi, Jawahar Nagar, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190008

places.generalDescription: Lhasa is a renowned Tibetan restaurant located near Dal Lake in Srinagar, Kashmir. It offers a delightful dining experience with its lip-smacking chicken dishes and a variety of vegetarian options recommended by the chefs. The restaurant is set in a beautiful garden where guests can enjoy their meals amidst picturesque surroundings. Known for its lively atmosphere and delicious food, Lhasa has become one of the best dining spots in the area.
places.name: Lhasa

reviews.text: Had a lovely experience here! The ambience was warm and inviting, with a cozy yet elegant setup that made the meal more enjoyable. The food was genuinely good ‚Äî well-cooked, nicely presented, and full of flavor. Everything we tried tasted fresh and satisfying. Service was smooth and friendly too. Prices were reasonable for the quality. Definitely a place I‚Äôd consider coming back to!

Lhasa is hands down the best place to try Tibetan food in Kashmir. Tucked away in a peaceful corner of Dal Lake banks, it offers not just great food, but a full experience, one that blends flavour, ambiance, and a touch of cultural memory. The name Lhasa itself evokes the spirit of resistance and identity, and it‚Äôs fitting that the restaurant carries forward that legacy through authentic, soulful cuisine rooted in Tibetan traditions.

The outdoor garden seating is a real charm, especially in the evenings. It‚Äôs spacious, green, and calm, making it perfect for long conversations over hot bowls of soup or a plate of well-cooked Fried Rice. The interiors are warm and inviting, with thoughtful design elements that reflect Himalayan culture without going over the top. Staff are highly professional, attentive, and respectful, ensuring you‚Äôre well taken care of without being intrusive.

As for the food, the quality is consistently impressive. The fried rice here, in particular, is unmatched. No other place in Srinagar even comes close to the balance of flavour and texture they‚Äôve perfected in that one dish. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for something light or a full Tibetan meal, Lhasa delivers on both taste and authenticity.

Highly recommended for anyone looking to explore beyond the usual Mughlai and Wazwan circuit. It‚Äôs not just a restaurant, it‚Äôs a quiet nod to a culture that continues to thrive through its food

I recently visited Lhasa Hotel. I ordered the mutton kebab, which was good though I felt a hint of soya

The Lhasa Special Soup was truly excellent and a definite must try

The Schezwan fried rice however felt a bit undercooked

The butter chicken with naan was good and

the overall environment of the hotel was pleasantüëç

A good restaurant with a cozy ambiance.
We visited them on a cold night in Srinagar. The place was temperature controlled so that made us even more comfortable.
They serve good Chinese, Tibetan, Afghani and Indian cuisines.
We had Veg Machow Soup, Veg Wonton and Chilli Garlic Noodles.
The food was delicious and the portions are good too. The staff were courteous.

A very kind gesture by the restaurant owner to have us dropped back to our hotel as it wouldn't stop raining.

Location of hotel is opposite to dal lake
Food quality is excellent & very tasty. we tried Chinese,Kashmiri wazwan cuisine,kababs
I wish to visit this place next time
Service staff is very helpful in giving advice about food & menu

places.address: Lane No 3, Boulevard Road, Near Shah Abbas Hotel, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190001

places.description: Straightforward destination for international fast-food bites including burgers, pizzas & shakes.
places.generalDescription: Mummy Please is a fast food restaurant that specializes in burgers, pizzas and shakes. The menu has a variety of options to choose from, so there's sure to be something for everyone. The restaurant is clean and convenient, making it the perfect spot for grabbing a quick bite on the go.
places.name: Mummy Please

reviews.text:
We bumped into this place on our last day in Srinagar. We were hanging out in Lal chowk and ghanta ghar and became very hungry doing street shopping. We had to try the famous Kashmiri Wazwan and we got it here. It was mouth watering. Steam rice with 5 types of mutton. The place was crowded as it was peak lunch time, but they have multiple floors, so we got place to sit quickly. We also tried tandoori chicken which was amazing.
Do try below items if you visit :
Kashmiri Wazwan Thali (contains 5 types of mutton)
Tandoori chicken
Also the place is located in market area so visit when you are going to Lal chowk for shopping.

I recently visited this restaurant and unfortunately, my experience was far from satisfactory.

To start with the positives, the ambience was quite nice ‚Äî the place had a pleasant atmosphere and seemed well-maintained. However, that‚Äôs where the good things ended.

The service was very poor. When we arrived, no one paid attention to us for a long time. It took over 20 minutes before someone even came to take our order, which was quite frustrating.

As for the food, I ordered the biryani, which was priced at ‚Çπ160 per plate, but it was nowhere close to what a biryani should be. It came with just one small piece of chicken, an oily pile of rice that looked more like a fried pulao than biryani, and a tiny serving of what they called raita, which didn‚Äôt taste like raita at all. There was no onion salad, which is usually a basic complementary item with biryani. The food was extremely oily and unhealthy, and given the taste and quality, it certainly wasn‚Äôt worth the high price.

I didn‚Äôt try the other food items because, as they say, first impression is the last impression. It wouldn‚Äôt be fair of me to say all their dishes are bad based only on this one experience, so this review is specifically about the biryani, which I hope helps others make an informed choice.

Overall, despite the good ambience, the poor service, overpriced menu, and substandard biryani make it hard for me to recommend this place, at least for biryani lovers. I hope they improve their food quality and service in the future.

Great ambience, loose staff, unapologetic, quite unsatisfying biryani, fried rice okay. Better for family lunch or dinner.
Washroom probably never been smoked.

During my trip to Srinagar, I had lunch in this very famous and old restaurant. Restaurant's location was great, near Lal Chowk. The hotel staff were very humble and cooperative. Ambience was very good with traditional rich Kashmiri flavour. Food was good and served in copper Trami and glasses. I would  recommend it to friends and family members .

Worst quality, quantity, taste and service.
I today visited mummy please restaurant amira kadal and such a nightmare experience ever had in any restaurant. I ordered 1. chicken fried rice Full, 2. Honey Chilly potato Full and 3. Mutton tikka.. chicken fried rice was fried in used fish oil and without any sauce, smelled and tasted like fish fried rice, Honey chilly Potato quantity was 1/4th than that other top restaurants provide,, Mutton tikka was without mutton and just grilled fat pieces that were not even propery swallowed with low quality nan/lawasa and low quality chutneys... kindly go through this review and attached photograph before visiting this worst so called mummy please restaurant.

places.address: and, Lal Chowk, &, Residency Road, near gurudwara, near police station, Lal Chowk, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190001

places.generalDescription: Amigo's Foods & Hospitalities is a popular spot, especially among the younger crowd, known for its diverse menu that includes pizzas, burgers, continental and Indian dishes. It was the first to introduce top-notch pizza in Kashmir and is considered one of the best family restaurants in Srinagar. While it can get crowded, the prompt service and consistently good food make it worth the wait.
places.name: Amigo's Foods & Hospitalities

reviews.text:
I had a great experience at Amigos Food!
The food was fresh ,tasty, and served hot- especially  the [ insert your favorite item, like Zinger burgar or Pizza], which was absolutely delicious.
The staff was polite and quick in taking in orders.
Cleanliness was on point and the seating arrangement was comfortable.
Prices were reasonable for the quality and quantity offered.
Perfect spot for hangouts, families,  or a quick bite.
Highly recommend visiting if you're around.

I recently dined at Amigos, and I must say, the food is absolutely top-notch! Each dish was bursting with flavor and expertly prepared. The highlight of my meal was definitely the Manchurian‚Äîit's a must-try! The perfect balance of spices and textures made it unforgettable. The ambiance was inviting, and the service was friendly and attentive. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a fantastic dining experience!
Edit: 3rd visit; Biryani was not upto the mark. Chutney didn't taste well. It really needed a flavor.

I ordered butter chicken , well if you want to taste some kind of innovation in a butter chicken  go for it . LMAO!!! Such a weird experience. Don't Go for butter chicken .you can understand by the colour of it

I wish Google had 10 star rating so I could have whole heartly with pleasure pleased to share a 10 star rating.
First of all it has a very special and elaborate veg menu and the staff are so kind and humble
We had a very nice time and the food was really a 10 star + class. We were lucky to visit such a authentic place in Srinagar. Well done to the Management . The food was cherry on the Blossom

This is one of the best restaurant of Srinagar city. Located opposite to Amar singh college This restaurant offers a great place to dine in, the ambience is great, their service is top notch and the food is mouth watering.I have visited the restaurant many times and they have never let the name down. Hats off to their consistency and dedication.  During the recent visit we tried their Schezwan chicken wings and Cheese burst Pizza.Both the dishes are recommended especially Cheese burst Pizza. The only things i dont like is the road near the restaurant and high rush on weekends.

places.address: opp. Amar Singh College, Gogji Bagh, Main Gate, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190008

places.description: Noodle & rice dishes, tandoori meats & hefty desserts in a comfortable setup with a water feature.
places.generalDescription: Stream Restaurant is a popular dining spot for both locals and tourists, offering a diverse menu in a cozy setting. The restaurant serves Indian, Chinese, and Continental cuisine, with particular praise for its Kashmiri dishes. Visitors can enjoy favorites like Chicken Rogan Josh and Pulao in the comfortable environment, making it an ideal choice for casual gatherings or family meals. Additionally, the restaurant is known for its vegan options and reasonable prices throughout the week.
places.name: Stream Restaurant

reviews.text:
Had an absolute delight at Steam Restaurant! üåü The moment I stepped in, I was blown away by the ambiance - the perfect blend of modern chic and cozy warmth. The location is also a huge plus, easily accessible and surrounded by a great view.

The veg food options were incredibly diverse and delicious. Each dish was thoughtfully prepared, showcasing the chef's skill and creativity. The service was top-notch, with friendly and attentive smiling staff who made sure our needs were met throughout the meal.

However, I did encounter a minor issue with one piece of meat in my dish, which wasn't up to the mark. But what truly impressed me was the manager's response - he apologized and mentioned that if he had known, he would have offered to change the dish. This level of accountability and customer care speaks volumes about the restaurant's commitment to quality and customer satisfaction.

Overall, I'd highly recommend Steam Restaurant for its ambiance, veg food, and service. With a bit of quality control tweaking, they'll be unstoppable! üëç

A Delightful Culinary Experience at Stream Restaurant, Srinagar

Stream Restaurant in Srinagar is truly a gem for anyone seeking great food, warm hospitality, and a cozy ambiance in the heart of the city. During our recent visit, we had the pleasure of dining here and were thoroughly impressed.

The menu is diverse, offering a great selection of Indian, Mughlai, Kashmiri, and continental dishes. Every item we ordered was flavorful, well-presented, and freshly prepared. The Kashmiri Wazwan specials are a must-try‚Äîrich in taste and authenticity.

What really stood out was the attentive and courteous staff, who ensured that our dining experience was smooth and enjoyable. The service was prompt, and the team was always happy to guide us with recommendations based on our preferences.

The interiors are tastefully done, providing a pleasant and comfortable atmosphere whether you're there for a quick bite or a leisurely meal. The restaurant is also well-maintained and clean, which adds to the overall positive vibe.

Located conveniently, it's easy to reach and ideal for both tourists and locals. Whether you're exploring the nearby markets or just looking for a good place to unwind after a day of sightseeing, Stream Restaurant is a perfect pick.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Srinagar!

Drivers will recommend this restaurant as they get commission for the bill amount. This restaurant does not even serve hot water for free. The waiter told me that they can only serve hot water by boiling the water in the bottle kept on the table whose MRP is 60 rs whereas we all know that the standard water bottle MRP is only 20 rs. The food quality is average, wash room hygiene is poor, service is average.

"From the moment we stepped in the restaurant, the warm, welcoming service set the tone for an unforgettable afternoon. The restaurant's ambiance is truly beautiful, creating a serene and inviting atmosphere. Every dish of authentic Kashmiri food was a culinary delight, bursting with rich, genuine flavors that transported us straight to the valleys of Kashmir. And the walnut tart? Absolutely the cherry on top ‚Äì a perfect, sweet ending to a truly exceptional dining experience. Highly recommended for a taste of Kashmir!"

Stream Special Chicken Absolutely the Best Chicken Dish I‚Äôve Ever Had!

From the very first bite, this chicken dish was a flavor bomb! The meat was incredibly tender and juicy, cooked to perfection with just the right amount of spices. The marinade had clearly soaked in well, giving each bite a rich, layered taste without being overpowering

Nisar was attentive, polite, and made our dining experience truly enjoyable.

places.address: Boulevard Road, Opp.Ghat No. 2, Dalgate Bridge, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190001

places.generalDescription: Fork and Spoon, a renowned eatery close to the Royal Boulevard hotel in Srinagar, is highly regarded for its delectable cuisine. This establishment proves to be a haven for enthusiasts of Rogan Josh, offering them an unparalleled dining experience. Moreover, the prices at this venue are quite reasonable. Among their must-try delicacies are KFC momos which are simply irresistible. The staff members are friendly and hospitable, ensuring that every customer has an enjoyable mealtime.
places.name: Fork and Spoon

reviews.text: This place serves delicious food and authentic kashmiri wazwan food. Bring vegetarian guy, I enjoyed eating veg dishes prepared and served by them. Their hospitality, quality of food and good ambiance make it a perfect place to look out for in the scenic vicinity of Dal Lake in Srinagar City.
Good food . I would recommend tandoori chicken and chicken fried rice

"I hope this review reaches the restaurant. I had ordered a deal meal from them, which included biryani and chicken kanti. I was really excited to try the meal, and initially, everything seemed fine. However, in the evening, I started experiencing stomach pain and realized I had food poisoning. I have no idea what kind of chicken it was - whether it was actually chicken or something else. It was absolutely terrible.

You offer deals, but in doing so, you compromise with people's lives. At the very least, the food should be good and not expired or bad enough to cause food poisoning:)

This is one of the best restaurants in Kashmir Dal lake ghat no. 8 area which is also budget friendly. The behaviour of the stuff is really good, polite and friendly. The atmosphere is peaceful and relaxing. If I could, I would give it a 10 star ratings. I‚Äôll recommend  this place to anyone visiting Kashmir on a budget.
Thank You.
Served tasty food . Space is good and the staff is good but seems little costlier menu as they served butter chicken 4 pices at a cost of 350 rs

places.address: 3RMQ+628, Tangbagh, Boulevard Road, Old Gagribal Road, opposite to ghat no 8, Durgjan, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190001

places.description: Soft-serve ice cream & signature shakes top the menu at this classic burger & fries fast-food chain.
places.name: DQ Grill & Chill Veg&Non veg

reviews.text: Today I was at Parker's and I met a waitress there who gave me such good service. I have never had such good service anywhere. Thank you so much. Idu    and I want this lady in my  restaurant.

Delicious food. Clean and tasty. Good atmosphere. Should taste Thandoori chicken, kadai chicken. Hotel owner Raju, He was very active and smart Handling. Good attitude also.
Should try here.

Worst Naan ever (pic attached). Both the Naan were not worth Rs 10.
Chicken Dopyaza was Oily and average.

Quick Bites Delight Near Srinagar Airport!
Had a fantastic experience at DQ Grill & Chill! This is conveniently located near Srinagar International Airport, making it a perfect spot for quick bites before or after a flight. The service was impressively fast, and the staff was incredibly polite and accommodating. The quality of the food was good. Highly recommended!
Best hotel near by airport for veg & non, dum briyani is awesome likr

places.address: New Airport Rd, near jk bank, Humhama, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190021

places.generalDescription: Tao Restaurant & Caf√© is a charming eatery located in the heart of Srinagar, offering a serene and romantic ambiance surrounded by nature. The restaurant features delightful outdoor seating and serves up delicious Indian, Kashmiri, and Chinese cuisine to satisfy your cravings. With its single-story infrastructure and beautiful flower lawns, Tao provides a unique dining experience where you can enjoy the fragrant flower petals while savoring your meal.
places.name: Tao restaurant & caf√©

reviews.text: Service was slow. Good for people want to sit for long and have conversations. I took soup and parote. Soup was little salty. Maybe people take more salt here. And Parita was spicy again for my taste. I liked the ambience a lot. Outdoor place between the trees!
One of the finest dine in experiences in Srinagar. Very tasty food and choice between outdoor and indoor seating is great especially in summer. The shade of a majestic Chinar does the cooling best.

Tao Restaurant & Cafe is one of the oldest and most established spots in town, and it continues to maintain its charm. Known for its consistency, Tao serves a wide range of Indian, Chinese, and continental dishes ‚Äî all prepared with good flavor and care.

The ambiance is calm and welcoming, making it a reliable choice for both casual meals and special outings. Whether you‚Äôre going for their classic dishes or just dropping by for coffee and snacks, the experience is usually satisfying.

It‚Äôs a place that has stood the test of time ‚Äî definitely worth a visit if you appreciate tradition with taste.

Absolutely pathetic experience!

The food they serve isn‚Äôt subpar, the behaviour of their staff is unacceptable. I got into an argument with one of their staff members and almost everyone from their team pounded on me. GUESS WHY? Because I took around 45 mins to finish the coffee I‚Äôd ordered. They kept insisting that I can‚Äôt spend so much time sipping the coffee THAT I PAID FOR, and that I had to order something to eat to be able to sit there. I was so shocked. This is shameful.

I‚Äôd never recommend anyone to go there. It‚Äôs a waste of time, money, and worst of it, your mood will be spoiled for the entire day.

Honestly, such a terrible experience for me.

The food is pretty average but the behaviour of the staff is EXTREMELY BAD. I was there for an important conversation and ordered a black coffee. The staff kept on coming, interrupting and asking me to order something more. I was so irritated that I went inside and paid the bill. I got no apology. Even after that, I had a huge fight with them. They stooped so low, telling me I should have finished my coffee in 10 mins and ordered something else quickly. (I MEAN, WOW!) Terrible experience. Won‚Äôt recommend ever.

places.address: Residency Road, near GPO, Munshi Bagh, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190001

places.description: An easygoing atmosphere, kitschy decor & wooden seating in a spot for pizza & Continental snacks.
places.generalDescription: Lacima Cafe and Pizzeria is a charming vegetarian restaurant nestled in the heart of Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. The cozy ambiance, complete with quirky decor and wooden seating, sets the stage for a delightful dining experience. This eatery offers an array of Italian and cafe-style delicacies, from delectable pizzas to comforting pasta dishes, burgers, momos, and an assortment of tempting desserts like cheesecakes and red velvet treats.
places.name: Lacima Cafe and Pizzeria

reviews.text:
I have been to this place a long time ago. Back then, they were located just outside of GMC Srinagar. Their food at that time was average. Nothing great. Not bad either.

But when I went to their new restaurant recently, I was amazed by the changes. In the new restaurant as well as in the food.

Their food quality and taste has improved so much. It went from 4/10 to a 7/10 or even 8/10 ( for me though)

I had chicken momos, a pizza and a burger. The burger was just amazing. The bun was fresh. And soft. Not those regular tasteless buns that you see everywhere. The patty too was full of taste and juicy. The burger was a surprise for me. You don't find this kind of burger in Kashmir. At least I haven't till now.

Didn't like the mint chutney though. They can do with some more chutneys.

The pizza was better than what they used to make in the past. It was crisp and cheesy.

That burger will surely make me go back there.
Nice ambience, Tasty food and Excellent staff.

Lacima is a hidden gem in Kashmir and offers an exceptional dining experience in Kashmir. The restaurant's warm ambience creates a welcoming atmosphere for all occasions. Their menu shines with standout dishes.

Pizza: Among the best in Kashmir, with perfect crust and fresh toppings.
Momos: Delicious dumplings served with an excellent complementary sauce.

The staff, including the owner, provide friendly and attentive service.

The best place for Italian food in Srinagar! The owner and the staff are very friendly and courteous. The food, especially the garlic cheese bread and pizza were fresh and tasty. Do try their proprietary momos topped with cream and veggies!

It says a lot about your food and service when you have repeat customers at your restaurant, that too tourists. Yes it happened to me during my visit to Srinagar. Visited this place on my first day in Srinagar and now on the last day as well. They make absolutely great pizzas, breads and momo (with their own twist with their inhouse yummy sau e). I am sure they are equally good in other dishes but I didn't get to taste them. They serve good shakes and mojitos as well. It may seem like a simple order, but you need to taste all this, to experience the fine balance and the crispness, not to forget the great love with which they serve food.

The man in charge / owner Shaukat (known as Shauki) is an amazing human being, courteous, polite and serves with a big smile on his face. Ambience is modern and slick. Check out the pics.

Do visit this place next time you are in Srinagar.

Pros - Good food, ample parking, reasonable cost, clean washroom, hygenic, free smiles, stairs with side rails.

Con - This is on 1st floor. Not complaining but just for your information, just in case you have an elderly or a sprained ankle.

places.address: Gole Market, Karan Nagar, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190010

places.name: New Cottage Inn

reviews.text: I recently revisited a restaurant I hadn‚Äôt been to in a year, and unfortunately, my experience was disappointing. The service and food quality used to be great, but over the past couple of months, both have drastically declined. The service was abysmal, with no waiters in sight, and the food was far from its previous standard. To top it off, the price hike was not at all justified. It‚Äôs sad to see a place that once had great potential fall short in so many areas. I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll be returning anytime soon.Hope you will resolve this issue ...
This place is very small and seems to be occupied by kids. The staff is very unwelcoming and the food they offer is very basic for a high price. Walked out without trying the food.
Very nice restaurant and the food is amazing and its ambience is so nice.

Pathetic  behavior   ! I ordered a half chicken tandoori , had to wait for 45 minutes and another customer got the half chicken tandoori in 2 minutes ! They were delaying my order ! So that they could make a full chicken tandoori together !   Now the quality of the food and atmosphere doesnt matter to me ! If it wasnt unethical , Would have thrown away the food straight away !

Had ordered Chicken curry via Gatoes today. The order was in "preparing" state for almost an hour. Delivery called me and said these people haven't prepared the food and are asking him to buy ingredients. Laughable but pathetic behaviour. Have raised a complaint with Gatoes as well.

places.address: Main Road, Rawalpora, Badgam, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir 190019

places.description: Kashmiri & Wazwan specialities served in 3 traditional dining halls at a basic hotel.
places.generalDescription: Mughal Darbar is a renowned restaurant in Srinagar, Kashmir, known for its traditional wazwan and Mughlai cuisine. It offers a wide variety of non-vegetarian dishes and delectable bakery items like cakes and pastries. The restaurant is popular among tourists and locals alike for its top-tier quality food at an affordable price. Located near the majestic Dal Lake, it's a must-visit destination to satisfy your culinary desires while exploring the beautiful Kashmir Valley.
places.name: Mughal Darbar

reviews.text: On the last day of our trip to Kashmir, We went to Mughal Darbar for authentic Kashmiri wazvaan food and it was an amazing experience. We ordered 1 dish for four persons at Rs.1200/-. It was more than enough quantity for us. It was delicious and very tasty food. All the items were very tasteful. Good experience.

I recently had dinner here, and I was quite disappointed. The food quality didn‚Äôt match as per my expectation. it tasted more like something from a basic roadside dhaba. The ambiance was decent, but the food needs a serious upgrade to justify the cost.
Had lunch at Mughal Darbar for Kashmir cousins. They served one. It‚Äôs quite interesting. The half plate is sufficient for more than 4 people. It has a very strong aroma of mutton.
